Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Mendez.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Council Member Larry Seabrook.
Council Member Mendez moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 13, 2006 be adopted and printed by Council Member Reyna.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Reyna moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 13, 2006 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council, Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 060334 ZSM, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 505-513 W. 43rd St Hotel, Manhattan (C060334ZSM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Civil Service and Labor

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the three-platoon system of the department of correction, and to repeal subdivision e of section 9-116 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to removal of the correction commissioner for having failed to install a system of rotating tours of duty.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Three-platoon system of the department of correction.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Economic Development
A Local Law to amend the Administrative Code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an application for redesignation of certain areas within the city of New York as empire zones.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an application for redesignation of certain areas within the city of New York as empire zones.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the extension of the Village Alliance business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Extension of the Village Alliance business improvement district.

Items.Title: Resolution endorsing the Speaker’s decision to file, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of Suffolk County in the litigation between the Retail Industry Leaders Association ("RILA") and Suffolk County for the purpose of supporting the City’s Health Care Security Act (Local Law number 89 for the year 2005 and Local Law 1 for the year 2006).
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Resolution endorsing the Speaker’s decision to file, on behalf of the Council, an amicus brief in support of Suffolk County in the litigation between the Retail Industry Leaders Association ("RILA").

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to compensation of the mayor, public advocate, members of the city council, borough presidents, comptroller and district attorneys.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Compensation of the mayor, public advocate, members of the city council, borough presidents, comptroller and district attorneys.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Finance and the Environmental Control Board to implement Chapter 45 of the Laws of New York for the year 2000 in relation to the enforcement of Environmental Control Board judgments against certain owners for building code violations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: The enforcement of Environmental Control Board judgments against certain owners for building code violations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to make Veterans Day a permanent school holiday.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYC Department of Education to make Veterans Day a permanent school holiday.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the New York city department of education to report on the status of science labs in public schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYC Dep't of education to report on the status of science labs in public schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the New York city department of education to report on the progress of preparatory programs for students who seek admission to specialized senior high schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYC Dep't of education to report on the progress of preparatory programs for students who seek admission to specialized senior high schools.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A. 6502, an act to amend the executive law in relation to enacting the SAFETY act, which would prohibit discrimination and harassment in New York State Office of Children and Family Services facilities and require that facility staff be trained to respond appropriately to such behavior.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Enacting the SAFETY Act (A.6502)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass the Safe Harbour for Exploited Youth Act, S.4423/A.6597, which would amend the social services law, the family court act, and the penal law in relation to services for sexually exploited youth.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Pass the Safe Harbour for Exploited Youth Act (S.4423/A.6597)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.6334-A/S. 6877-A, which would create the Office of the Child Advocate to oversee the New York State Office of Children and Family Services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Create the Office of the Child Advocate (A.6334-A/S. 6877-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the City of New York to cease purchasing products from Tar Heel, North Carolina’s Smithfield Packing Company, and urging supermarkets operating in our city to cease purchasing Smithfield products from Tar Heel, North Carolina until the company ends all forms of abuse, intimidation and violence against its workers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: NYC to cease purchasing products from Tar Heel, North Carolina’s Smithfield Packing Company.

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, November 15, 2006.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use subcommittee.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of Mary Gay Taylor, longtime City Hall reporter for WCBS-AM (Newsradio 88), who died of breast cancer at the age of 71 on October 20, 2006. She is survived by her mother and two sisters.  Her family called for a fight for a cure and urges women at risk to have annual mammograms.
